name: The Chango as the National Bird
name_original: The Chango as the National Bird
description:
Fly thru the playas (beaches) of Puerto Rico as a Chango, learning why the Chango should be the Puerto Rican National Bird. 

Get the exclamation marks (!) so you can read the essay directly from different birds.

On PC use the directional keys to move the Chango, but on mobile just swipe to the direction you want to go.

The Chango (Mozambique, Machambo, Quiscalusnigerbrachypterus, Greater Antillean grackle) is bird from Puerto Rico (my country) that looks like a little crow. You can spot a Chango in every corner of the island.

If you want to learn more about this "little crow", check the links below:

  • Wikipedia info in English
  • Info en Wikipedia en español
  • Info suministrada de edicionesdigitales.info
  • Info suministrada de cienciapr.org
  • The Cornell Lab of Ornithology (Info in English y español)

If you know Spanish, you can read the essay by Magali García Ramis; El chango como pájaro nacional, click/tab here!

Si sabes español, puedes leer el ensayo en español por Magali García Ramis; El chango como pájaro nacional, haz click/tab aquí!
